sentence.Network_en: They have a strong record of financial soundness.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们有着极佳的财务记录，可以证明他们的财务状况良好。

sentence.Network_en: I can appreciate his humanitarian zeal; it is the soundness of his thought that I question.
sentence.Network_cn: 我能够理解他的人道主义热忱，我质疑的是他的观点是否正确。

sentence.Network_en: We had taken great pains to check the structural soundness of the coachwork.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们下了很大的工夫检查汽车车身的结构是否安全。

包含韵的词语 | 常用词典 | 中华博物 ... ◆ 全韵[  rime suffisante ] ◆ 声韵[ sound ] ◆ 声韵学[  phonology ].

entry.def: A sound is something that you hear.

example.ex: Peter heard the sound of gunfire...
example.tran: 彼德听见了枪炮声。

example.ex: Liza was so frightened she couldn't make a sound...
example.tran: 莉莎实在吓坏了，不敢弄出一点声音来。

entry.tran: 声(指通过空气、水或其他物质传播的一种能量)
entry.def: Sound is energy that travels in waves through air, water, or other substances, and can be heard.

example.ex: The aeroplane will travel at twice the speed of sound.
example.tran: 这架飞机的速度将是音速的两倍。

entry.tran: (电视、收音机、CD 机等可调节音量的)声音，音响
entry.def: The sound on a television, radio, or CD player is what you hear coming from the machine. Its loudness can be controlled.

example.ex: She went and turned the sound down...
example.tran: 她去把音量关小了。

example.ex: Compact discs have brought about a vast improvement in recorded sound quality.
example.tran: 激光唱片极大地提高了录音的音质。

entry.tran: (歌手或乐队的)音乐风格，乐曲特色
entry.def: A singer's or band's sound is the distinctive quality of their music.

example.ex: They have started showing a strong soul element in their sound...
example.tran: 他们的音乐风格开始表现出一种强烈的灵乐特色。

example.ex: He's got a unique sound and a unique style.
example.tran: 他的音乐风格独具特色。

entry.def: If something such as a horn or a bell sounds or if you sound it, it makes a noise.

example.ex: The buzzer sounded in Daniel's office...
example.tran: 丹尼尔办公室里的蜂音器响了。

example.ex: A young man sounds the bell to start the Sunday service.
example.tran: 一个年轻人鸣钟宣布周日的礼拜开始了。

entry.tran: 发出(警告等);(以…语调)发表
entry.def: If you sound a warning, you publicly give it. If you sound a note of caution or optimism, you say publicly that you are cautious or optimistic.

example.ex: The Archbishop of Canterbury has sounded a warning to Europe's leaders on third world debt...
example.tran: 坎特伯雷大主教就第三世界的债务问题向欧洲的领导人发出了警告。

example.ex: Others consider the move premature and have sounded a note of caution...
example.tran: 其他人认为采取这个行动为时尚早，对此提出了警告。

entry.def: When you are describing a noise, you can talk about the way it sounds .

example.ex: They heard what sounded like a huge explosion...
example.tran: 他们听见一声爆炸般的巨响。

example.ex: The creaking of the hinges sounded very loud in that silence...
example.tran: 在那片寂静之中，铰链吱吱嘎嘎的声音听起来很响。

entry.def: When you talk about the way someone sounds, you are describing the impression you have of them when they speak.

example.ex: She sounded a bit worried...
example.tran: 她的语气里有一点担心。

example.ex: Murphy sounds like a child...
example.tran: 墨菲的口气像个孩子。

entry.tran: (用于谈论印象或观点)听起来，似乎
entry.def: When you are describing your impression or opinion of something you have heard about or read about, you can talk about the way it sounds .

example.ex: It sounds like a wonderful idea to me, does it really work?...
example.tran: 听起来这个主意很不错，真的能行吗？

example.ex: It sounds as if they might have made a dreadful mistake...
example.tran: 听起来他们似乎犯下了一个可怕的错误。

entry.tran: (对于听说或读到的事情的)印象
entry.def: You can describe your impression of something you have heard about or read about by talking about the sound of it.

example.ex: Here's a new idea we liked the sound of...
example.tran: 这是个新想法，我们一听就喜欢。

example.ex: I don't like the sound of Toby Osborne...
example.tran: 我不喜欢托比·奥斯伯恩的那一套。

entry.tran: (身体)健康的;(心智)健全的;(建筑)坚固的
entry.def: If a structure, part of someone's body, or someone's mind is sound, it is in good condition or healthy.

example.ex: When we bought the house, it was structurally sound...
example.tran: 我们买下这栋房子的时候，它的结构还非常坚固。

example.ex: Although the car is basically sound, I was worried about certain areas...
example.tran: 尽管这辆汽车基本状况良好，我还是担心一些地方不够安全。

entry.tran: (建议、推理或证据)正确的，合理的，可靠的，明智的
entry.def: Sound advice, reasoning, or evidence is reliable and sensible.

example.ex: They are trained nutritionists who can give sound advice on diets...
example.tran: 他们都是受过训练的营养学家，能够在饮食方面提出合理的建议。

example.ex: Buy a policy only from an insurance company that is financially sound...
example.tran: 一定要从财务状况良好的保险公司购买保险。

entry.def: If you describe someone's ideas as sound, you mean that you approve of them and think they are correct.

example.ex: I am not sure that this is sound democratic practice...
example.tran: 我不能肯定这是正确的民主行为。

example.ex: I think the idea of secularism is a very sound one...
example.tran: 我认为现世主义的观点非常正确。

entry.def: If someone is in a sound sleep, they are sleeping very deeply.

example.ex: She had woken me out of a sound sleep.
example.tran: 她把我从酣睡中叫醒。

means.word_mean: 1. a state or condition free from damage or decay
2. the quality of being prudent and sensible
3. the firmness and tone of healthy tissue;

auth_sentence.content: He built in that safety and soundness throughout the industry.
auth_sentence.res_content: He built in that safety and soundness throughout the industry.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He built in that safety and soundness throughout the industry.

auth_sentence.content: This fiscal soundness would encourage companies to invest in the state.
auth_sentence.res_content: This fiscal soundness would encourage companies to invest in the state.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This fiscal soundness would encourage companies to invest in the state.

auth_sentence.content: The general soundness of the Sino-Japanese relationship was evident from topics not discussed.
auth_sentence.res_content: The general soundness of the Sino-Japanese relationship was evident from topics not discussed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The general soundness of the Sino-Japanese relationship was evident from topics not discussed.
